newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares may rebound after Monday drop.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares may rebound after Monday drop.

text.p: Singapore shares look set for a temporary rebound on Tuesday but sentiment remains weak for the long term, dealers said.
On Monday the benchmark Straits Timex Industrials Index (STI) ended just above a 23-month low following a heavy sell-off on New York on Friday and amid rumours of funds switching out of equities.

But a sharp rise on Wall Street overnight and some technical correction could aid prices temporarily, one dealer said. However, others said they expect further tightening on public housing credit, which could hurt the property sector.
Little buying sentiment has been seen, pessimistic dealers added.
Neptune Orient Lines shares, which start trading after being suspended following announcement of a takeover of the U.S. container shipper APL, will be closely watched, dealers said.
